abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Third Telecommunications Project in
            Indonesia. The primary development objectives of the project
            were defined as follows: (a) to assist the GOI in improving
            overall management of the sector; (b) enhance Perusahaan
            Umum Telekomuinikasi, PERUMTEL’s (Telecommunications Public
            Corporation) institutional capability; and (c) support
            cost-effective and efficient implementation of a large
            investment program. The performance of the Borrower, the
            Beneficiary and of the Bank were all highly satisfactory.
            Three important lessons were learned during the
            implementation of the project : (i) first,is active
            participation and commitment of all stakeholders not only
            during implementation but also preparation are prerequisites
            for success in reforming of public utilities operating in
            monopoly environment; (ii) second lesson, continuity of
            competent and committed personnel, with proper skill mix, at
            the Borrower, Project Entity, and the Bank, and above all,
            decisive leadership by the Borrower are critical to the
            creation of mutual trust and understanding for resolving the
            many sensitive issues involved in sector reform of large
            public utilities; (iii) third, inclusion of policy
            conditionality’s in loan agreements is not a pre-requisite
            to effective Bank intervention on major policy issues or
            assurance that agreed policy reforms are undertaken.
